cristinas - (05/06/2009 12:55): hi!  
florinciu - (05/06/2009 12:56): hi  
sdumitriu - (05/06/2009 12:57): Hi  
cristinas - (05/06/2009 12:57): I have problem .. regarding the gui fro the navigation panel .. the developers from open office didn't answer to me  
cristinas - (05/06/2009 12:57): and I don't have yet a solution  
cristinas - (05/06/2009 12:57): how to implement it  
sdumitriu - (05/06/2009 12:58): Well, you can start by putting it inside a dialog triggered by a menu entry  
sdumitriu - (05/06/2009 12:58): The code shouldn't change much when going to a correct panel  
cristinas - (05/06/2009 12:59): ok, i can try this  
cristinas - (05/06/2009 12:59): should I create also the tree in the dialog with events?  
cristinas - (05/06/2009 12:59): (I don't know if I will be able to keep the tree in the new panel  
florinciu - (05/06/2009 13:01): cristinas: did you try the drawing framework that I specified in my last reply?  
florinciu - (05/06/2009 13:03): http://xwiki.markmail.org/search/?q=Florin+Ciubotaru+task+pane#query:Florin%20Ciubotaru%20task%20pane+page:1+mid:wbs5456janf5i4b4+state:results  
cristinas - (05/06/2009 13:03): I've looked over it, but it doesn't seem to work with swrtiter.  
cristinas - (05/06/2009 13:03): I didn't write the code exactly  
florinciu - (05/06/2009 13:05): ok, then if it doesn't work you must think at a design for a dialog as Sergiu said. Please consult with tachirei for a consistent UI. He has the same problem on Word 2003.  
cristinas - (05/06/2009 13:06): ok, thanks  
cristinas - (05/06/2009 13:08): I hope that the dialog it's just a temporal solution for xoo
